title: Arsenal Women Start WSL Season at the Emirates - Full 2025 / 26 Fixtures Revealed
body_text:
The wait is over, Gooners.. Arsenal Women’s full Barclays WSL fixture list for the 2025-26 season has finally landed!
Our Gunners will kick off the new campaign in front of a home crowd at the Emirates Stadium on Saturday, 6th September when we welcome newly-promoted London City Lionesses. The match is scheduled for 1:30pm kick-off and will be broadcast live on BBC One – the perfect start to what promises to be another thrilling season for our Champions of Europe.
Tickets are already on sale through Arsenal here, so make sure you secure your seat for opening day and help pack out N5 from the very first whistle.
Another big season ahead for Arsenal Women
September is packed with early tests. After our opener, the team head east for a London clash against West Ham, followed by a trip north to face Manchester United. We’ll be back at the Emirates to take on Aston Villa before the month is out.
November brings a huge headline fixture, as Chelsea visit the Emirates in a match that could shape the title race. Then in February, we welcome Manchester City, completing a home double against our two main rivals.
History will also be made this season. For the first time ever, all 11 of Arsenal Women’s home WSL games will be played at the Emirates Stadium – a powerful statement of Arsenal Women’s place at the heart of the club. No more split venues. N5 is our Gunneresses true home.
Our north London derbies are set for November (away) and March (home), while the season concludes in May with matches against both Merseyside clubs – hosting Everton before a final day trip to Anfield.
Arsenal fans can also subscribe to the official Arsenal calendar to download these fixtures straight to their devices and stay updated with any changes throughout the season.
2025/26 FIXTURE LIST
SEPTEMBER
Sat 6 – London City Lionesses (H) – Emirates Stadium
Sun 14 – West Ham United (A) – Chigwell Construction Stadium
Sun 21 – Manchester United (A) – Leigh Sports Village
Sat 27 – Aston Villa (H) – Emirates Stadium
OCTOBER
Fri 3 – Manchester City (A) – Joie Stadium
Sun 12 – Brighton & Hove Albion (H) – Emirates Stadium
NOVEMBER
Sun 2 – Leicester City (A) – King Power Stadium
Sat 8 – Chelsea (H) – Emirates Stadium
Sun 16 – Tottenham Hotspur (A) – Brisbane Road
DECEMBER
Sat 6 – Liverpool (H) – Emirates Stadium
Sun 14 – Everton (A) – Goodison Park
JANUARY
Sun 11 – Manchester United (H) – Emirates Stadium
Sun 25 – Chelsea (A) – Stamford Bridge
Sat 31 – Leicester City (H) – Emirates Stadium
FEBRUARY
Sun 8 – Manchester City (H) – Emirates Stadium
Sun 15 – Brighton & Hove Albion – Broadfield Stadium
MARCH
Sun 15 – London City Lionesses (A) – The CopperJax Community Stadium
Sat 21 – West Ham United (H) – Emirates Stadium
Sun 29 – Tottenham Hotspur (H) – Emirates Stadium
APRIL
Sun 26 – Aston Villa (A) – Villa Park
MAY
Sun 3 – Everton (H) – Emirates Stadium
15/16/17 – Liverpool (A) – Anfield
All fixtures are subject to change.
Looking forward to the new season kicking off Gooners?
Thankfully we have the UEFA Women’s Euro 2025 to keep us fueled up on football for now – who do you think will walk away as Euro 2025 Champs?
COYGW!
Michelle M
